intro: Heeria schinzii, commonly known as the mountain heeria, is a flowering plant native to the Andes. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pink flowers and elliptical leaves. It thrives in high-altitude regions with cool, moist climates. Heeria schinzii is often found in rocky or forested areas, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
